GridUtil (service in module ui.grid.util )

Description

Grid utility functions

Methods

  • elementHeight(element, [extra])

    Parameters

    • element – {element} –

      DOM element

    • [extra] – {string} –

      Optional modifier for calculation. Use 'margin' to account for margins on element

    Returns

    {number} –

    Element height in pixels, accounting for any borders, etc.

  • elementWidth(element, [extra])

    Parameters

    • element – {element} –

      DOM element

    • [extra] – {string} –

      Optional modifier for calculation. Use 'margin' to account for margins on element

    Returns

    {number} –

    Element width in pixels, accounting for any borders, etc.

  • getColumnsFromData(data)

    Return a list of column names, given a data set

    Parameters

    • data – {string} –

      Data array for grid

    Returns

    {Object} –

    Column definitions with field accessor and column name

    Example

    var data = [
  { firstName: 'Bob', lastName: 'Jones' },
  { firstName: 'Frank', lastName: 'Smith' }
];

var columnDefs = GridUtil.getColumnsFromData(data);

columnDefs == [
 {
   field: 'firstName',
   name: 'First Name'
 },
 {
   field: 'lastName',
   name: 'Last Name'
 }
];

  • getTemplate()

    Get's template from Url

    Returns

    {object} –

    a promise resolving to template contents

    Example

    GridUtil.getTemplate(url).then(function (contents) {
     alert(contents);
   })

  • newId()

    Return a unique ID string

    Returns

    {string} –

    Unique string

    Example

    var id = GridUtil.newId();

# 1387305700482;

  • normalizeWheelEvent(event)

    Given an event from this list:

    wheel, mousewheel, DomMouseScroll, MozMousePixelScroll

    "normalize" it so that it stays consistent no matter what browser it comes from (i.e. scale it correctl and make sure the direction is right.)

    Parameters

    • event – {event} –

      A mouse wheel event

    Returns

    {event} –

    A normalized event

  • readableColumnName(columnName)

    Parameters

    • columnName – {string} –

      Column name as a string

    Returns

    {string} –

    Column name appropriately capitalized and split apart

    Example
